ccproblem.name: prob_6_1
ccproblem.description:
Write a program that reads an integer (which you may assume will be positive) and prints all of the integers from 1 to that integer, on a single line.

For example, if the integer read by the program is 7, then the program should print a line reading 

1 2 3 4 5 6 7

Hint: make sure that there is at least one space between each number. In other words, if the integer is 4, then the output should be 1 2 3 4, not 1234.

If the program produces more than 20 lines of output, it will terminate and the test will fail.
